wikipedia_page.main: William Mariner  (29 May 1882 – 1 July 1916) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Rifleman William Mariner VC (1882–1916), soldier awarded the Victoria Cross at Cambrin in 1915.
